question: The Important Bird Area (IBA) “Baie de Boueni” is located in which island?
explanation: Baie de Boueni is a large bay located in the Mayotte Islands, an overseas region of France in the western Indian Ocean located between Madagascar and Mozambique. It is an Important Bird Area (IBA) in which it’s coastal fringe holds the largest area of mangroves in the Comoros Archipelago, which supports bird populations such as Madagascar pond-herons, Mayotte drongos, red-headed foodies, etc.
